rdfs:label: Personal Data Handling
dct:description:
Top Class to describe a concrete instance of legal personal Data Handling of a defined class of Data Subjects, meaning that a personal Data Category is undergoing specified processing by a specific data controller and/or
transferred to some recipient for a particular purpose, based on a specific legal ground, with specified security measures and restrictions (e.g. storage locations and storage durations).
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Personal Data Category
dct:description: A category of personal data (as defined by GDPR article 4.1) from the personal data categories taxonomy, i.e. for instance denoting the category of an object/field or data item that is used for processing
dct:creator: Harshvardhan Pandit, Axel Polleres

rdfs:label: Processing
dct:description: A type of processing from one of the processing categories in the processing Taxonomy
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Purpose
dct:description: The purpose of Data Handling, from the purposes Taxonomy
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Recipient
dct:description: The entities that can access the result of a data handling action/processing, any legal entity that is defined by article 4.9 of GDPR, which states - 'recipient' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body, to which the personal data are disclosed, whether a third party or not.
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Technical and Organisational Measure
dct:description: Technical and organisational measures, for instance security measure, storage restrictions etc. required/followed when processing data of the declared category
dct:creator: Bud Bruegger

rdfs:label: Legal Basis
dct:description: A particular legal Basis, which permits personal Data handling (e.g. Consent, etc.)

rdfs:label: Data Subject
dct:description: The class of Data Subject that this particular data handling applies to, any legal entity that is defined by article 4.1 of GDPR.
rdfs:comment: The alternative to bind a user or role of users to a policy could be to have a special property "hasPersonalDataHandling"
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Data Controller
dct:description: The class of Data Controllers that control this particular data handling, any legal entity that is defined by article 4.7 of GDPR.
dct:creator: Axel Polleres, Javier Ferenandez

rdfs:label: Entity
dct:description: Represents an Entity (Legal definition). Is used to collect different entities within DPV such as individuals, organisations, recipients.
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit
